div.a: Will Sugar Be Regulated Like Cigarettes?

div.div: Robert Lustig is on a crusade to have sugar regulated like alcohol. He wants products full of sugar to get health warnings, like on cigarette packs. Sugar, he says, is toxic in high doses, and should be treated as such.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RvtaoH&via=Digg&text=Will Sugar Be Regulated Like Cigarettes?

div.div: A once-modern facility after 27 years of nuclear contamination and neglect.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VxoQ8W&via=Digg&text=Inside Chernobyl's Abandoned Hospital

div.div: PREPARE FOR SOME ANGRY STATUS UPDATES

div.a: Would You Use Facebook if It Looked Like This?

div.div: if you thought Timeline was radical, check out this (unofficial) prototype.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ujeqf0&via=Digg&text=Would You Use Facebook if It Looked Like This?

div.div: IF YOU'RE A TAILOR, YOU'VE GOT IT MADE
University professors and enlisted military personnel are at the opposite ends of the spectrum when it comes to the stresses of the job, new research has found.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TKUZb9&via=Digg&text=The Most (And Least) Stressful Careers

div.a: What Happens If You Mistakenly Write 2012 On A 2013 Check?

div.div: So you foggily wrote last year’s date on a check, your memory or fine motor skills lagging behind the calendar. Will that come back to bite you?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XnAwxR&via=Digg&text=What Happens If You Mistakenly Write 2012 On A 2013 Check?

div.a: The Evolution Of An Epic Minor League Hockey Brawl

div.div: A recent game in the Southern Professional Hockey League (which exists!) featured a bench-clearing slobberknocker worthy of the NHL, resulting in 129 combined penalty minutes for fighting, throwing equipment and spearing. Here's a frame-by-frame breakdown of the brouhaha.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VziqUa&via=Digg&text=The Evolution Of An Epic Minor League Hockey Brawl

div.a: A Tiny City Built To Be Destroyed By Cyber Terrorists, So Real Cities Know What’s Coming

div.div: CyberCity takes up a mere 48 square feet, but it has a working electric grid, transportation system, and banking network. And it’s routinely under attack by hackers whose plans are worse than stealing credit card numbers: they want to destroy the city itself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UI3whb&via=Digg&text=A Tiny City Built To Be Destroyed By Cyber Terrorists, So Real Cities Know What’s Coming

div.a: Hot Chocolate Tastest Much Better In An Orange Cup

div.div: Scientists have discovered that an orange or creme-colored cup definitely makes chocolate taste better, while a white or red cup will not enhance the flavor.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TyNFkb&via=Digg&text=Hot Chocolate Tastest Much Better In An Orange Cup

div.div: WE AWAIT THE BIRTH OF AN IMMORTAL MOUSE

div.a: A Guide To The Next 150 Years

div.div: What's going to happen in 2013? In ten year's time? 50 years? 100? We look ahead to see what the future holds according to predictions from thinkers, scientists and pundits -- and the odds of them happening.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10NimWS&via=Digg&text=A Guide To The Next 150 Years

div.a: The Inside Story Of An American Journalist Missing In Syria

div.div: Family and colleagues lift the secrecy surrounding the kidnapping of James Foley, the U.S. journalist abducted on Thanksgiving Day.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZVhMqV&via=Digg&text=The Inside Story Of An American Journalist Missing In Syria

div.div: AND YOU CAN'T MANAGE TO FIND THAT SLIP

div.a: How UPS Moves 2,000 Packages Every 17 Seconds

div.div: UPS relies on Worldport in Louisville, Kentucky: a 5.2 million-square-foot processing facility that's capable of sorting up to 416,000 packages an hour.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/136zVQz&via=Digg&text=How UPS Moves 2,000 Packages Every 17 Seconds

div.a: Ashton Kutcher’s Steve Jobs Film Due In April

div.div: The biopic traces Jobs’s life from college dropout to co-founder of Apple, and includes major moments in his life from 1971 through 2000.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S7ct4s&via=Digg&text=Ashton Kutcher’s Steve Jobs Film Due In April

div.div: 'I KNEW MY ACTIONS MIGHT COST HIM HIS LIFE'

div.a: The Man Who Betrayed Bradley Manning

div.div: More than two years after Manning's arrest, the man who gave him up sits down for an interview about how he made his decision.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WgEMZf&via=Digg&text=The Man Who Betrayed Bradley Manning

div.div: NOT AS ELEMENTARY AS HE MAKES IT LOOK

div.a: How To Think Like Sherlock Holmes

div.div: What the detective can teach us about observation, attention, and happiness.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VDFMat&via=Digg&text=How To Think Like Sherlock Holmes

div.a: Why is Gerard Depardieu Becoming Russian?

div.div: Oscar nominee's legacy in his home country is a bit more complicated after he announced he was renouncing his French citizenship and has now -- apparently -- been granted a Russian passport by order of Vladimir Putin himself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YYmSwC&via=Digg&text=Why is Gerard Depardieu Becoming Russian?

div.a: This Is Why You Can't Stop Eating

div.div: High fructose corn syrup is in practically everything we eat these days, and doctors and health nuts have been waxing poetic about its dangers for years. Now, a new study from Yale University School of Medicine may finally prove them the right: fructose is making us fat.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TIj9Tz&via=Digg&text=This Is Why You Can't Stop Eating

div.div: YOU CAN STOP POKING GARY FROM ACCOUNTING NOW

div.a: You Can't Get Fired For Complaining About Your Job On Facebook

div.div: It’s become harder to fire workers for griping online.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UITXxk&via=Digg&text=You Can't Get Fired For Complaining About Your Job On Facebook

div.div: HAVE YOU BEEN NAUGHTY OR NICE?

div.a: How Obama Decides Your Fate If He Thinks You're A Terrorist

div.div: A look inside the "disposition matrix" that determines when -- or if -- the administration will pursue a suspected militant.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VxYUr6&via=Digg&text=How Obama Decides Your Fate If He Thinks You're A Terrorist

div.div: These images look more like illustrations from some cracked version of Alice in Wonderland than they do images from any textbook we’ve ever seen.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VlbI4s&via=Digg&text=Surreal Illustrations From 1970s Psychology Textbooks

div.div: The company will launch an update to its Messenger app for iOS and Android on Thursday afternoon, allowing users to send short voice messages to one another inside of the application, up to a minute in length.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tzn1Yl&via=Digg&text=Facebook Messenger Finds Its Voice

div.a: Antarctic IRC: How NASA's Flying Lab Stays Connected

div.div: Dialing up San Jose over satellite connections from 500m over the Antarctic.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/X0lgD3&via=Digg&text=Antarctic IRC: How NASA's Flying Lab Stays Connected

div.a: 'Upside-Downing' Is The Latest Stupid Photo Trend

div.div: A compilation of photos of people upside down, without photoshop.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/131cWqP&via=Digg&text='Upside-Downing' Is The Latest Stupid Photo Trend

div.div: BEFORE THE RUSSIANS SENT THEIR BEETS

div.a: How Two Guys Launched The First Hot Dog Into The Stratosphere

div.div: This is a story about good ol' American ingenuity. It's a story about ambition and processed meat, about believing in dreams and reaching for the stars. It's the story of the first hot dog in space.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UnxYLf&via=Digg&text=How Two Guys Launched The First Hot Dog Into The Stratosphere

div.a: Take A Video Tour Of The International Space Station

div.div: NASA astronaut Sunita Williams, who has spent almost a year in space, gives a 25-minute tour of the International Space Station.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1342fmA&via=Digg&text=Take A Video Tour Of The International Space Station

div.div: And we’re all better off for the demise of the $400 future of computing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RtJTsh&via=Digg&text=Apple Killed The Netbook

div.a: What Are The Fastest Growing And Shrinking Economies In 2013?

div.div: Here's a quick look at which economies are growing and which are contracting heading into 2013.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S6RDSE&via=Digg&text=What Are The Fastest Growing And Shrinking Economies In 2013?

div.div: This classic short film shows how to make an igloo using only snow and a knife.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/105bHL&via=Digg&text=How To Build An Igloo

div.a: The Hidden Element Behind Violent Crime

div.div: New research finds that lead is the hidden villain behind violent crime, lower IQs, and even the ADHD epidemic. And fixing the problem is a lot cheaper than doing nothing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WmMktP&via=Digg&text=The Hidden Element Behind Violent Crime
